p:
A/Brisbane/59/2007 (H1N1) and mouse-adapted A/Puerto Rico/8/34 (H1N1) viruses were obtained from the influenza division Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) repository and were propagated in 10-day-old embryonated chicken eggs as previously described.
39 Pooled allantoic fluid was clarified by centrifugation, aliquoted, and stored at −80°C until use. Both viruses were sequenced at the CDC for HA and NA, and titered for plaque-forming units (PFUs) in MDCK cells. The titer for A/Brisbane/59/2007 is 1.55 × 10 8 PFUs/mL and A/Puerto Rico/8/34 is 2 × 10 9 PFUs/mL.
